attachments.title: Oregon State Parks waiving fees for Black Friday
attachments.text: Parks across Oregon will be free the day after Thanksgiving, with special programming offered around Portland.

text: <https://www.eventbrite.com/e/autodesk-hits-portland-2016-tickets-28591782792?aff=>

attachments.title: Autodesk Hits Portland 2016
attachments.text: 3DV & Autodesk Present"Autodesk Hits Portland 2016"@ the Empirical Theater at OMSIFree parking - Free event Schedule:5:00 - 6:30 Beer/Wine, Food & Networking6:30 - 9:00 Demonstration9:00 - Raffle - Wacom Intuos Pro, Bamboo Folio & SlateSee the New Formlabs Form 2 - 3D Printer in actionThis is a free event for creative, technical, and marketing professionals. Come early to mix, mingle and network with industry peers over delicious appetizers and drinks.Join friends and colleagues at this special event where Autodesk and 3DV will present new tools, products, and processes for the Entertainment and Design industries.Watch live demos and presentations to learn how these tools and techniques enable you to create more compelling content faster, and enter to win one of three (3) Wacom giveaways: Intuos Pro Medium, Bamboo Folio Large and Bamboo Slate smallWho Should AttendAnyone involved in the entertainment, product, architectural/environmental, industrial, transportation, or motion design industries.Content creators for any media: marketing, advertising, motion graphics, VR, high end web, broadcast, VFX, animation, videogames or mobile content.Marketing professionals looking to take that next step in competitive differentiation of design and visual messaging.Why You Should AttendNew tools and workflows in software such as VR are opening doors to new and improved design processes facilitating better, faster iterations, leading to more creative solutions in Entertainment and Design.Higher levels of audience sophistication and competition for impressions and eyeballs is fierce and only the most compelling images get noticed.The Cloud standardizes project management tools facilitating and optimizing small and large productions and also offer unlimited, on-demand computing power.Technology is driving disruptive changes in most industries: this event is focused on helping you keep up with those changes.What You Will LearnIncrease your knowledge of how new Autodesk tools, products, workflows, and services are enabling “The Future of making Things”.Watch a live show on tools and techniques in Maya, Max, Shotgun, Remake and more on topics such as VR, Content Creation Tools, Cloud etc. that you can incorporate in workflows immediately to enhance your visual content faster.Event Sponsors Wacom will be on hand in person to discuss how their solutions support the “Future of Making Things”. Some of their latest products will be on display to try out.Speakers:Jose M. ElizardoTechnical Specialist, AutodeskJose Elizardo is an expert extraordinaire when it comes to anything and everything related to Autodesk® 3ds Max. He’s been with Autodesk for over 10 years, and his experience in the media and entertainment industry have made him a specialist of visualization and Live Design.Marcel de JongTechnical Team Lead – Americas, AutodeskMarcel specializes in 3D production for Film/TV and Design. He worked as a digital FX consultant for studios such as Dream Quest Images and Warner Digital. His background is in Industrial/Concept Design and his work has been published in ‘Popular Mechanics’, ‘ID magazine’, ‘CGW’, and ‘Innovation’.Today Marcel provides various technical services for many Autodesk Film and TV customers ranging from smaller to larger accounts such as ILM, Pixar, and DreamWorks. Marcel is also a co-founder of Gnomon Inc.Thanks to our sponsors / partners for making this event possible:Autodesk 3DVWacom3DPDXVFXPDXAEPDXCascade SIGGRAPH

text: I went to this two years ago when they hosted it somewhere else and it was a really great event. Would love to go again if others are interested.
I just signed up
My buddy works at autodesk just told me about it
Anyone know if we have an audio splitter?
channel based or just like stereo two jack?
either way, i’d be shocked if we dont
<@U0H4SJN11>
Stereo, for two headphones
We might. I'll check
thanks <@U0H4SJN11> i’d be for the room in here while we work on a video edit

<!channel> Just a reminder that our Uncorked clothing swap is this Thursday night after work. Thinking we'll meet around 5:30/45 in social space. I'll have trash bags for any leftovers that people want to donate instead of taking home.

smartass
for low quality stuff an app for your phone is the best. we have a printer/copy/scanner in the ops room, not sure that it is art quality.

and kate has a feed scanner
